dt: {bc}the quality or state of being {a_link|active} {bc}behavior or {a_link|actions} of a particular kind
{bc}a process (such as digestion) that an organism carries on or participates in by virtue of being alive
{bc}a similar process actually or potentially involving mental function
{bc}an educational procedure designed to stimulate learning by firsthand experience
{bc}a pursuit in which a person is active
{bc}a form of organized, supervised, often extracurricular recreation

dt.t: The camp offers hiking, swimming, and other {it}activities{/it}.

dt: {bc}an organizational unit for performing a specific function

dt.t: the restaurant inspection {wi}activity{/wi} of the health department

et: Middle English {it}actyvete{/it} "active life," borrowed from Middle French & Medieval Latin; Middle French {it}activité{/it} "power of acting, exercise of this power," borrowed from Medieval Latin {it}āctīvitāt-, āctīvitās{/it} (Late Latin, "active form of a verb"), from Latin {it}āctīvus{/it} {et_link|active:1|active:1} + {it}-itāt-, -itās{/it} {et_link|-ity|-ity}
shortdef: the quality or state of being active : behavior or actions of a particular kind
natural or normal function: such as

dt: {bc}ability of a chemical substance to rotate the plane of vibration of polarized light to the right or left

shortdef: ability of a chemical substance to rotate the plane of vibration of polarized light to the right or left

utxt.t: And forget the parenting magazine advice that recommends folding laundry as a great {wi}co-activity{/wi}.

dt: {bc}the act or process of {d_link|displacing|displace} {bc}the state of being displaced

dt.t: a storm that caused the {wi}displacement{/wi} of thousands of people

dt: {bc}the volume or weight of a fluid (such as water) displaced {dx_def}see {dxt|displace||2a}{/dx_def} by a floating body (such as a ship) of equal weight
{bc}the difference between the initial position of something (such as a body or geometric figure) and any later position
{bc}the volume displaced by a {d_link|piston|piston} (as in a pump or an engine) in a single stroke
{bc}the total volume so displaced by all the pistons in an {d_link|internal combustion engine|internal combustion engine}
{bc}the redirection of an emotion or impulse from its original object (such as an idea or person) to another
{bc}the substitution of another form of behavior for what is usual or expected especially when the usual response is nonadaptive or socially inappropriate

shortdef: the act or process of displacing : the state of being displaced
the volume or weight of a fluid (such as water) displaced by a floating body (such as a ship) of equal weight
the difference between the initial position of something (such as a body or geometric figure) and any later position

dt: used figuratively to describe someone as very interested in or excited about something

dt.t: He was {it}bitten by the travel bug{/it}.

shortdef: —used figuratively to describe someone as very interested in or excited about something
